Line 1: Line 1: â
[[Image:Atlanta Falcons helmet rightface.png|thumb|180px|right|The expansion Atlanta Falcons selected players from existing franchises.]]
 
The '''1966 NFL Expansion Draft''' was a [[National Football League]] (NFL) [[NFL Draft|draft]] in which a new [[expansion team]], named the [[Atlanta Falcons]], selected its first players. On June 30, [[1965 NFL season|1965]], NFL Commissioner [[Pete Rozelle]] awarded the first NFL franchise in the [[Deep South]] to the city of [[Atlanta, Georgia]] and granted ownership to [[Rankin Smith Sr.]]<ref name=HOF1966>{{cite web |url=http://www.profootballhof.com/history/story.jsp?story_id=1998|title=1966 NFL Draft|accessdate=2008-09-27 |publisher=Pro Football Hall of Fame}}</ref>
The '''1966 NFL Expansion Draft''' was a [[National Football League]] (NFL) [[NFL Draft|draft]] in which a new [[expansion team]], named the [[Atlanta Falcons]], selected its first players. On June 30, [[1965 NFL season|1965]], NFL Commissioner [[Pete Rozelle]] awarded the first NFL franchise in the [[Deep South]] to the city of [[Atlanta, Georgia]] and granted ownership to [[Rankin Smith Sr.]]<ref name=HOF1966>{{cite web |url=http://www.profootballhof.com/history/story.jsp?story_id=1998|title=1966 NFL Draft|accessdate=2008-09-27 |publisher=Pro Football Hall of Fame}}</ref>
